oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Strengthening organic food value chains in Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Münchhausen, von, Susanne
Schulz, Kristin
Haering, Anna Maria
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Produce chain management
Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Our paper starts with a short overview of the diversity of organic food chains in Germany. Building on this, a study area with the typical diversity of organic food value chains in Germany will be selected. We show that – within the same region and for the same product group – several different supply chains coexist. Smaller businesses tend to focus on market niches and particular consumer groups and values. The in-depth analysis identifies the strengths and weaknesses of different types of organic food chains. Exemplarily, we highlight factors that can strengthen value chains for organic food.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Münchhausen, von, Susanne; Schulz, Kristin and Haering, Anna Maria (2013) Strengthening organic food value chains in Germany. Paper at: FOODSCAPES Conference: Access to Food – Excess of Food, Saggau, Austria, 22.-25.9.2013. [Submitted]
